title: Good Shirt, Green Shirt
description: This retro arcade-like game was the submission for a 72 hour game jam. I worked on many aspects of the main game loop as well as the UI animations. This was developed with 1 other person.

title: Athenaeum
description: This deckbuilding roguelike was our club's first ever long term project. I worked on the map's procedural generation. The project did go on for roughly another 3 months after I had stopped development.

title: Vision Fridge
description: This is a mobile app that I developed with a team for my internship at San Diego Supercomputer Center. It is a platform that allows users to follow recipes, share their cooking with their friends, and more.

title: Mariposa
description: This is a narrative, puzzle-platformer that is released on Steam. This was the Video Game Development Club's second large team, long term project. I was the lead developer for the puzzles in the game.

title: SNAKE2
description: This game is our team's take on what a 2-player version of the iconic "Snake" might have looked like and was developed over two weeks for a game jam.
